item.title: OpenAI bets big on audio as Silicon Valley declares war on screens
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The form factors may differ, but the thesis is the same: audio is the interface of the future. Every space -- your home, your car, even your face -- is becoming an interface.

item.title: The top 6 media/entertainment startups from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Here is the full list of the media/entertainment Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: Fizz social app’s CEO on why anon works
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Fizz is betting that Gen Z is tired of performing their lives on Instagram and TikTok.   What started as a pandemic-era group chat frustration has turned into the dominant social platform on college campuses across the US, focused on the 99% of life that doesn’t make it into a highlight reel. Capturing the attention of a demographic typically glued […]

item.title: ‘College dropout’ has become the most coveted startup founder credential
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: AI founders are increasingly using their "dropout" status as a credential during YC pitches.

item.title: Investors predict AI is coming for labor in 2026
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The exact impact AI will have on the enterprise labor market is unclear but investors predict trends will start to emerge in 2026.

item.title: These are the best gadgets for your pet right now
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From AI smart cameras that describe your pet's actions to a smart door that knows when they want to go outside, these are the best pet gadgets of 2025.

item.title: Tade Oyerinde and Teddy Solomon talk about building engaged audiences at TechCrunch Disrupt
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Founders Tade Oyerinde and Teddy Solomon spoke at Disrupt this year about keeping communities engaged.

item.title: Every fusion startup that has raised over $100M
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Fusion startups have raised $7.1 billion to date, with the majority of it going to a handful of companies.

item.title: The 10 top government, legal startups from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Here is the full list of the government and legal Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: The dumbest things that happened in tech this year
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: From Sam Altman's olive oil "scandal" to Soham Parekh's viral moment, a lot of silly stuff has gone down in tech this year.

item.title: The phone is dead. Long live . . . what exactly?
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: "We're not going to be using iPhones in 10 years," Callaghan says flatly. "I kind of don't think we'll be using them in five years."

item.title: Almost 80 European deep tech university spinouts reached $1B valuations or $100M in revenue in 2025
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: According to Dealroom’s European Spinout Report 2025, 76 European deep tech and life sciences spinouts have either reached $1 billion valuations, $100 million in revenue, or both.

item.title: 12 investors dish on what 2026 will bring for climate tech
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: After a tumultuous year, venture investors are still optimistic about climate tech's long-term prospects, especially as data centers continue to drive demand for electricity, manufacturing, and materials.

item.title: The best AI-powered dictation apps of 2025
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: AI-powered dictation apps are useful for replying to emails, taking notes, and even coding through your voice

item.title: VCs predict enterprises will spend more on AI in 2026 — through fewer vendors
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Enterprises have been experimenting with AI tools for a few years. Investors predict they will start to pick winners in 2026.

item.title: Here’s what you should know about the US TikTok deal
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: A number of investors are competing for the opportunity to purchase the app, and if a deal were to go through, the platform's U.S. business could have its valuation soar to upward of $60 billion.

item.title: Meta just bought Manus, an AI startup everyone has been talking about
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Meta says it'll keep Manus running independently while weaving its agents into Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, where Meta's own chatbot, Meta AI, is already available to users.

item.title: How to make your startup stand out in a crowded market, according to investors
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: At TechCrunch Disrupt, three investors took the stage to dissect what makes — and breaks — a pitch deck. Jyoti Bansal, a founder-turned-investor; Medha Agarwal of Defy; and Jennifer Neundorfer of January Ventures shared with the crowd their candid views on what works in a pitch deck — and what doesn't.

item.title: Social media follower counts have never mattered less, creator economy execs say
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: “I think that 2025 was the year where the algorithm completely took over, so followings stopped mattering entirely,” LTK CEO Amber Venz Box said.
